byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER

abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton says many of changes suggested in inspector general report about deficiencies in defining and tracking police officers' use of force are already being addressed; Bratton has expressed agreement with changes in rules on use of force, saying that, along with systematic reviews, they will help restore trust in the police, particularly among minorities.
lead_paragraph: Commissioner William J. Bratton was set to announce that many of the reforms called for in a new report by the inspector general for the police were already being addressed.

headline.main: Bratton, Tracking Police Use of Force, Aims to Stay Step Ahead of Watchdogs
headline.print_headline: Bratton Charts Own Path on Tracking Use of Force
